page.title: 16Religion
page.content: The village of Littlebeck is mainly a methodist village. It has its own chapel and belongs to the Methodist Circuit of Whitby. The Reverend is not resident but serves five other Methodist chapels in the area. Services are held every Sunday. There is no other church or chapel in Littlebeck. Catholics have to travel to Sleights or Whitby for services. The nearest Church of England is St. John's at Sleights, otherwise people attend Ruswarp. Sneaton or Whitby. There are no burial ground in Littlebeck. Father Postgate was caught in 1678 at Red Barn House whilst baptising a child and taken to York where he was hanged. Father Postgate's rosary and crucifix are still preserved in St. Hilda's Catholic Church, Whitby.
